reviewText: Steve Harvey has always acknowledged God for being everything.  In this comedy DVD, Steve Harvey's first ALL gospel comedy, he brings to the stage the same level of comedy that has made him one of the Kings of Comedy.  Steve reminds us constantly that "...he ain't through with me yet."  This is something everyone of all ages can watch and NOT worry about the language.  So don't expect Steve to be perfect, but he gives a perfect comedy performance.

reviewText: Lawdamercy, I cried!  The best scene, in my opinion, is when Steve is describing the woman asking her son "Billy" to "Come here a minute please?"  I laughed so hard, I cried!  It rang SO TRUE!  And for the poster "T Dub" or whatever he called himself, you can't relate.  You admitted you were not of the ethnic group that would find this funny, and that it why!  You didn't grown up with a black mother or grandmother!  Check out the man in the audience sitting in an aisle seat.  He's about to fall out of his chair!I first saw this on TV.  I even Tivo'ed it, but I want a copy without the commercials...just for the "Three-headed horse!"

reviewText: I have enjoyed Steve Harvey's comedy for many years, and was really happy after watching this that I could finally share this with my children.  Steve's jokes surrounding the church may offend some, but having been brought up as a "Church Kid" I find them accurate and hysterical.  I thoroughly enjoyed this and have already watched it a few times.  I hope he keeps up this style of comedy.
summary: Finally a Steve Harvey I can watch with Everybody

reviewText: Steve Harvey surprised me with this performance. Now, I like profanity and judging from S.H.'s other comedy specials, I didn't think he could perform a comedy special or be as funny without using any. Was I wrong. This was his best comedy performance yet. Most of the material is appropriate for all ages. Even though there is no profanity, a couple of segments are not for younger audiences. This DVD is highly recommendable.

reviewText: This video is extremely funny! Steve Harvey makes the kinds of observations about people that he is known for, and it's cleaned up for a Gospel convention crowd. He knows what a risk he took - since his best known comedy is R-rated. He is every bit as funny in this setting as he points out some of the hilarious flaws that we (or someone in our family or church) all should recognize. I have a lot more respect for Steve Harvey now that I have heard him speak boldly about his faith and show respect for a crowd that probably wondered what he was doing there in the first place!
summary: Harvey comedy for a Christian crowd

reviewText: I think Steve really did a wonderful job on making this DVD. He had some excellent material and the ending was awesome. I am sure that he scored some major points with God on that one.This is a must see and deserves 5 *****
Title: N/A

reviewText: This time he didn't deliver as he has in the past.  I agree with Steve that you don't have to curse to be funny.  I listen and look forward to his morning radio show and every day I'm still laughing when I get to work. But this show was built-up to be "his best work ever" and to me it fell short of that.Don't Trip, He Ain't Through With Me Yet wasn't as funny as I know Steve Harvey could be.  It didn't seem like he really had his material prepared. Although Steve is one of the best at coming up w/funny material at the drop of a dime, the production of this show didn't have me in stitches the way I know Steve can do.  I must say though that Ricky Smiley coming out on stage for a segment of the show was a nice added touch.I applaud Steve's efforts to make a bold change in his style of comedy. Even though I wasn't as moved as I expected to be, at least it was something that I could share with my Mother and Grandmother on a Sunday afternoon.  Now they truly enjoyed it and for that I'm happy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: One of the "Original Kings of Comedy" shows off another side of his talents in this concert film. Harvey performed a family-friendly show for an audience in which he delivered a hilarious but thought-provoking routine touching on the subjects of family, marriage, faith, and his personal relationship with God. This concert film gives you another perspective on Harvey's life and work. Very entertaining.
summary: Steve Harvey- Don't Trip... He Ain't Through With Me Yet!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Challenged by TD Jakes, this comedian delivers a profane-free comedy segment on stage that had Christians begging for more. Funny, family-oriented and a testament to an evolving Christian-minded comedian. This was one of the pivotal moments in this comedian's career, where he learns he can deliver the laughter with clean topics. Warning: there are some punch lines, related to sex, but all in fun.
Title: N/A
